elements.content: 1) What topics do you worry about most often?

elements.text:
2) Do your worries seem excessive or exaggerated to you? 
0 - Not at all excessive 
4 - Moderately excessive 
8 - Completely excessive

3) Over the past six months, how many days have you been disturbed by excessive worrying? 
0 - Never 
4 - Every other day 
8 - Every day

4) Do you have difficulty controlling your worries? For example, when you start worrying about something, do you have difficulty stopping? 
0 - No difficulty 
4 - Moderate difficulty 
8 - Extreme difficulty

elements.content: Over the past six months, have you often been disturbed by any of the following sensations when you were worried or anxious?

elements.text: Restlessness, feeling keyed up or on edge
Difficulty concentrating or mind going blank
Sleep disturbance (difficulty falling or staying asleep, or restless unsatisfying sleep)
6) To what extent does anxiety or worry interfere with your life, that is, your work, social activities, family, etc.? (Not at all = 0, Moderately = 4, Very severely = 8)

elements.content:
Scoring instructions:
To calculate the total QIA score, sum the responses to all items (except responses to item 1).

To meet the GAD criteria for the QIA, the person must report at least one worry theme, indicate a score of '4' or more on items 2, 3, 4 and 6, in addition to indicating a score of '4' or more on at least 3 of the 6 somatic symptoms (item 5).

Three other criteria categories can be met:
-Cognitive criterion (score of '4' or more on items 2, 3 and 4)
-Somatic criterion (score of '4' or more on at least 3 of the 6 somatic symptoms of item 5)
-No criterion (does not meet any of the preceding criteria)
